question: 1 (i)
sols_html:
Using the fact that

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{d}{dx} \sin^{-1}(x) = \frac1{\sqrt{1-x^2}},\end{aligned}\]

and the chain rule, we get

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{d}{dx} y &= \frac{d}{dx} \sin^{-1} (3x +1) \\ &= \frac{1}{\sqrt{1-(3x+1)^2}} \cdot \frac{d}{dx} (3x+1) \\ &= \frac{3}{\sqrt{1-(3x+1)^2}}.\end{aligned}\]
